slides.title: Welcome to SAP Controlling
slides.content:
# SAP Controlling (CO)

SAP CO is the module for **internal management reporting** and cost analysis, helping managers make informed business decisions.

## What You Will Learn

- **Cost Center Accounting** - Track costs by department
- **Internal Orders** - Track costs by project or event
- **Profit Center Accounting** - Analyze profitability by segment
- **Product Costing** - Calculate product costs

## CO vs FI

| Aspect | FI | CO |
|--------|-----|-------|
| Purpose | External reporting | Internal management |
| Users | Shareholders, regulators | Managers |
| Legal | Mandatory | Optional |
| Focus | Accuracy, compliance | Analysis, decisions |
| Time | Historical | Historical + Planning |

## CO Components

```
+------------------------------------------+
|            SAP CONTROLLING                |
+------------------------------------------+
| Cost Element | Cost Center | Internal   |
| Accounting   | Accounting  | Orders     |
+------------------------------------------+
| Profit Center | Profitability | Product |
| Accounting    | Analysis      | Costing  |
+------------------------------------------+
```

> **CO helps answer:** Where are we spending? Are we profitable?

slides.title: CO Organizational Structure
slides.content:
# Controlling Organizational Structure

## Key Organizational Units

### Controlling Area
- Primary organizational unit for CO
- Can span multiple company codes
- Defines currency and fiscal year

### Operating Concern
- Unit for Profitability Analysis (CO-PA)
- Defines characteristics and value fields

## Configuration

```
Controlling Area: 1000
    |
    +-- Operating Concern: 1000
    |
    +-- Company Code: 1000
    |       +-- Cost Centers
    |       +-- Profit Centers
    |
    +-- Company Code: 2000
            +-- Cost Centers
            +-- Profit Centers
```

## Assignment Relationships

```
Operating Concern
        |
        v
Controlling Area
        |
        v
Company Code(s)
```

## Key Configuration Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| OKKP | Create Controlling Area |
| OKP1 | CO Fiscal Year Settings |
| OKKS | Cost Center Standard Hierarchy |
| KEA0 | Operating Concern |

## Controlling Area Settings

- Currency type (company code or group)
- Assignment to operating concern
- Fiscal year variant
- Number ranges

> **Set up the structure correctly** for effective cost management!

slides.title: Cost Elements
slides.content:
# Cost Element Accounting

## What are Cost Elements?

Cost elements are the **classification of costs** for internal reporting - the CO equivalent of GL accounts.

## Types of Cost Elements

### Primary Cost Elements

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| 1 | Primary cost/expense |
| 3 | Accrual calculation |
| 4 | Accrual credit |
| 11 | Revenue |
| 12 | Sales deduction |

**Created from:** Existing FI GL accounts

### Secondary Cost Elements

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| 21 | Internal settlement |
| 41 | Overhead rates |
| 42 | Assessment |
| 43 | Internal activity allocation |

**Created only in CO** - no corresponding GL account

## Creating Cost Elements

### Primary (KA01)

```
GL Account: 515000
Controlling Area: 1000
Cost Element Category: 1 (Primary Cost)
```

### Secondary (KA06)

```
Cost Element: 900000
Controlling Area: 1000
Category: 42 (Assessment)
Name: Overhead Allocation
```

## Key Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| KA01 | Create Primary Cost Element |
| KA06 | Create Secondary Cost Element |
| KA03 | Display Cost Element |

> **Cost elements are the building blocks** of cost accounting!

slides.title: Cost Center Accounting
slides.content:
# Cost Center Accounting (CO-CCA)

## What is a Cost Center?

A cost center is an **organizational unit** where costs are incurred and tracked, typically representing departments or functions.

## Cost Center Hierarchy

```
Enterprise (Root)
    |
    +-- Administration
    |       +-- HR
    |       +-- Finance
    |       +-- IT
    |
    +-- Operations
    |       +-- Production
    |       +-- Quality
    |       +-- Warehouse
    |
    +-- Sales
            +-- North Region
            +-- South Region
```

## Cost Center Master

### Key Fields

| Field | Purpose |
|-------|--------|
| Cost Center ID | Unique identifier |
| Name | Description |
| Description | Detailed text |
| Hierarchy | Position in structure |
| Person Responsible | Manager |
| Cost Center Type | Category |
| Company Code | Legal entity |
| Validity Period | Active dates |

## Key Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| KS01 | Create Cost Center |
| KS02 | Change Cost Center |
| KS03 | Display Cost Center |
| OKEON | Cost Center Group |
| KSH1 | Create Cost Center Group |

## Cost Center Types

| Type | Description |
|------|-------------|
| H | Main cost center |
| F | Production |
| E | Sales |
| V | Administration |

> **Cost centers provide accountability** for departmental spending!

slides.title: Cost Center Planning and Posting
slides.content:
# Planning and Posting to Cost Centers

## Cost Center Planning

### Planning Elements
- Primary costs (expenses)
- Statistical key figures
- Activity types

### Planning Transaction (KP06)

```
Cost Center: 1000 (IT Department)
Fiscal Year: 2024

Primary Costs:
  515000 Rent:        $36,000
  516000 Utilities:   $12,000
  517000 Supplies:     $6,000
                      -------
  Total Planned:      $54,000
```

## Actual Posting

### From FI Documents
Automatic posting when expense recorded:

```
FI Entry (FB01):
  Dr: 515000 Rent    $3,000
  Cr: Bank           $3,000
  Cost Center: 1000

Automatic CO:
  Cost Center 1000: $3,000
  Cost Element 515000
```

### Direct CO Posting (KB11N)

```
Cost Element: 515000
Cost Center: 1000
Amount: $3,000
```

## Statistical Key Figures

Baseline data for allocations:

| KF | Description | Unit |
|----|-------------|------|
| SQFT | Square footage | M2 |
| HEDC | Headcount | NO |
| HOUR | Machine hours | H |

## Key Planning Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| KP06 | Cost Center Planning |
| KB11N | Manual Cost Posting |
| KP46 | Statistical Key Figure Planning |

> **Planning enables budget control** and variance analysis!

slides.title: Cost Center Allocations
slides.content:
# Allocating Costs Between Cost Centers

## Why Allocate?

- Distribute shared costs fairly
- Accurately reflect true cost of products/services
- Create accountability

## Allocation Methods

### 1. Assessment (KSU5)

Transfers **primary and secondary** costs:

```
Sender: 9000 (Facilities)
Receivers: Based on square footage

Cost of $10,000:
  - Production (5000 sqft): $5,000
  - Admin (3000 sqft):      $3,000
  - Sales (2000 sqft):      $2,000
```

### 2. Distribution (KSV5)

Transfers **primary costs only**:

```
Sender: 8000 (IT Support)
Receivers: Based on headcount

IT Costs $15,000:
  - Production (40 people): $6,000
  - Admin (35 people):      $5,250
  - Sales (25 people):      $3,750
```

## Allocation Cycle

```
+---------------------------+
| Cycle: MONTH-END          |
+---------------------------+
| Segment 1: Facilities     |
|   Sender: 9000            |
|   Receivers: All depts    |
|   Basis: Square footage   |
+---------------------------+
| Segment 2: IT Support     |
|   Sender: 8000            |
|   Receivers: All depts    |
|   Basis: Headcount        |
+---------------------------+
```

## Key Allocation Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| KSU5 | Execute Assessment |
| KSV5 | Execute Distribution |
| KSUB | Assessment Definition |
| KSVB | Distribution Definition |

> **Proper allocation** reflects true cost of operations!

slides.title: Internal Orders
slides.content:
# Internal Order Accounting

## What is an Internal Order?

An internal order is a **cost collector** used to track costs for specific purposes like projects, events, or capital investments.

## Order Types

| Type | Purpose | Example |
|------|---------|--------|
| Overhead | Temporary cost tracking | Marketing campaigns |
| Investment | Capital expenditure | Building construction |
| Accrual | Periodic cost spreading | Insurance accrual |
| Revenue | Track revenue | Trade fairs |

## Internal Order Master

### Key Fields

```
Order Number: 500001
Order Type: 0100 (Overhead)
Description: Q1 Marketing Campaign
Responsible: Marketing Manager
Company Code: 1000
Profit Center: 1001
Status: Released
```

## Order Status Management

```
Created --> Released --> Technically Complete --> Closed
    |           |               |                   |
    v           v               v                   v
  No posting  Postings     Settlement         Archived
  allowed     allowed      completed
```

## Key Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| KO01 | Create Internal Order |
| KO02 | Change Internal Order |
| KO03 | Display Internal Order |
| KO04 | Order Manager |
| KOB1 | Order Budgeting |
| KO88 | Settlement |

> **Internal orders provide flexibility** for tracking specific costs!

slides.title: Internal Order Budgeting and Settlement
slides.content:
# Managing Internal Orders

## Order Budgeting (KO22)

### Budget Elements
- Original budget
- Supplements
- Returns
- Available budget

### Example Budget

```
Order: 500001 Marketing Campaign

Original Budget:     $50,000
Supplement:          $10,000
Current Budget:      $60,000
Actual Costs:        $45,000
Commitments:          $8,000
Available:            $7,000
```

## Budget Control

Actions when budget exceeded:
- Warning message
- Error (block posting)
- Email to responsible

## Order Settlement (KO88)

### Settlement Rule

Defines where costs go after project completion:

```
Source: Order 500001
Settlement Receiver:
  - Cost Center 1000: 100%
  OR
  - Fixed Asset 1001: 100% (for investment orders)
```

### Settlement Types

| Receiver | Use Case |
|----------|----------|
| Cost Center | Overhead to department |
| GL Account | To P&L |
| Asset | Capitalize investment |
| WBS Element | To project |

### Settlement Execution

```
Order: 500001
Settlement Period: 12/2024
Total Amount: $55,000

Settlement:
  Dr: Cost Center 1000  $55,000
  Cr: Order 500001      $55,000
```

> **Settlement transfers completed costs** to final destinations!

slides.title: Profit Center Accounting
slides.content:
# Profit Center Accounting (EC-PCA)

## What is a Profit Center?

A profit center is an **organizational unit for internal profit reporting**, typically representing a business segment, product line, or region.

## Profit Center vs Cost Center

| Aspect | Cost Center | Profit Center |
|--------|-------------|---------------|
| Tracks | Costs only | Revenue AND costs |
| Purpose | Cost control | Profitability analysis |
| View | Expense focus | P&L focus |
| Level | Department | Business segment |

## Profit Center Hierarchy

```
Enterprise
    |
    +-- Product Line A
    |       +-- North America
    |       +-- Europe
    |       +-- Asia
    |
    +-- Product Line B
    |       +-- North America
    |       +-- Europe
    |
    +-- Services
            +-- Consulting
            +-- Support
```

## Profit Center Master

### Key Fields

```
Profit Center: 1001
Name: Consumer Products - NA
Hierarchy: Product Line A
Company Code: 1000
Manager: John Smith
Valid From: 01.01.2024
```

## Key Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| KE51 | Create Profit Center |
| KE52 | Change Profit Center |
| KE53 | Display Profit Center |
| KCH1 | Create Profit Center Group |
| 1KE5 | Profit Center Reports |

> **Profit centers show which segments** make or lose money!

slides.title: Profit Center Assignment and Reporting
slides.content:
# Working with Profit Centers

## Automatic Profit Center Assignment

### Rules-Based Assignment

| Master Data | Profit Center From |
|-------------|--------------------|
| Cost Center | Cost center master |
| Material | Material master (sales view) |
| Fixed Asset | Asset master |
| Order | Order master |

### Default Profit Center

Fallback when no assignment found:
- Configured per controlling area
- Used for unassigned postings

## Document Splitting

In New GL, profit centers enable:
- Segment-level balance sheets
- Full financial statements by profit center

```
Customer Invoice:
  Dr: Receivable     $10,000
  Cr: Revenue        $10,000

With Splitting:
  Receivable allocated by revenue profit center
```

## Profit Center Reports

### Profit and Loss by Profit Center

```
+--------------------------------+
| Profit Center: 1001 - NA       |
+--------------------------------+
| Revenue:           $500,000    |
| Cost of Sales:     (300,000)   |
| Gross Profit:       200,000    |
| Operating Exp:     (120,000)   |
| Operating Profit:    $80,000   |
| Margin:                16%     |
+--------------------------------+
```

### Key Reports (1KE5)

| Report | Shows |
|--------|-------|
| Actual/Plan | Variance analysis |
| Balance Sheet | Assets by segment |
| P&L Statement | Profitability |
| Comparison | Period comparisons |

> **Profit center reporting** drives strategic decisions!

slides.title: Product Costing Introduction
slides.content:
# Product Costing (CO-PC)

## What is Product Costing?

Product costing **calculates the cost of manufacturing products** by combining material, labor, and overhead costs.

## Product Cost Types

### Standard Cost
- Predetermined cost
- Basis for pricing and valuation
- Set at period start

### Actual Cost
- Real costs incurred
- Captured during production
- Compared to standard for variance

## Cost Components

```
+------------------------+
|    PRODUCT COST        |
+------------------------+
| Material Costs         |
|   - Raw materials      |
|   - Components         |
+------------------------+
| Production Costs       |
|   - Direct labor       |
|   - Machine time       |
+------------------------+
| Overhead Costs         |
|   - Factory overhead   |
|   - Administration     |
+------------------------+
```

## Costing Methods

| Method | Use Case |
|--------|----------|
| Standard Costing | Repetitive manufacturing |
| Actual Costing | Job shop, projects |
| Product Cost Collector | Mass production |

## Key Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| CK11N | Create Cost Estimate |
| CK24 | Release Cost Estimate |
| CK40N | Costing Run |
| CKMLCP | Actual Costing Run |

> **Product costing supports pricing** and profitability decisions!

slides.title: Cost Estimate Structure
slides.content:
# Creating Product Cost Estimates

## Prerequisites

1. **Bill of Materials (BOM)**
   - List of components
   - Quantities required

2. **Routing**
   - Production steps
   - Work centers
   - Operation times

3. **Activity Types**
   - Labor rates
   - Machine rates

## Cost Estimate Elements

```
Product: Finished Good FG001
Quantity: 1 EA

Material Costs:
  Component A (2 EA x $10):     $20.00
  Component B (1 EA x $15):      15.00
  Raw Material (0.5 KG x $8):     4.00
                                ------
  Total Materials:               $39.00

Production Costs:
  Labor (0.5 hr x $25/hr):       $12.50
  Machine (0.25 hr x $40/hr):     10.00
                                ------
  Total Production:              $22.50

Overhead:
  Factory Overhead (20%):        $12.30
                                ------
Total Product Cost:              $73.80
```

## Costing Variants

Define how cost is calculated:
- Which BOM to use
- Which routing to use
- Costing date
- Valuation variant

## Key Reports

| Report | Shows |
|--------|-------|
| CK13N | Display Cost Estimate |
| S_ALR_87013611 | Cost Estimate List |
| KKBC_HOE | Cost Object Hierarchy |

> **Accurate cost estimates** enable informed pricing!

slides.title: Profitability Analysis
slides.content:
# Profitability Analysis (CO-PA)

## What is CO-PA?

Profitability Analysis analyzes **profit contribution by market segments** like products, customers, regions, or channels.

## CO-PA Types

### Costing-Based
- Values assigned from cost estimates
- Faster posting
- Less detailed

### Account-Based
- Values from cost elements
- More detailed
- Reconciles to FI

## Characteristics and Value Fields

### Characteristics (Dimensions)

| Characteristic | Example |
|----------------|--------|
| Customer | ABC Corp |
| Product | Widget A |
| Region | North America |
| Sales Org | 1000 |
| Channel | Direct |

### Value Fields (Measures)

| Value Field | Description |
|-------------|-------------|
| Revenue | Sales amount |
| Discounts | Price reductions |
| Cost of Sales | Product cost |
| Freight | Shipping costs |
| Commission | Sales commission |

## CO-PA Data Flow

```
SD Billing --> CO-PA Posting
    |
    v
Characteristics + Value Fields
    |
    v
Profitability Report
```

## Key Transactions

| TCode | Function |
|-------|----------|
| KE21N | Create CO-PA Document |
| KE24 | Display CO-PA Document |
| KE30 | Run CO-PA Reports |
| KEA0 | Maintain Operating Concern |

> **CO-PA reveals where you make money!**

> **Reports enable data-driven decisions!**

slides.title: Period-End in CO
slides.content:
# CO Period-End Closing

## Monthly Activities

### 1. Allocations

```
1. Run assessment cycles (KSU5)
2. Run distribution cycles (KSV5)
3. Execute overhead calculation
4. Settle internal orders (KO88)
```

### 2. Posting Checks

```
- Verify all FI postings have CO assignment
- Check for missing cost centers
- Reconcile FI to CO balances
```

### 3. Reporting

```
- Run variance reports
- Generate management reports
- Analyze profitability
```

## CO Closing Checklist

| Step | Transaction | Description |
|------|-------------|-------------|
| 1 | KB11N | Post manual adjustments |
| 2 | KSU5 | Assessment cycle |
| 3 | KSV5 | Distribution cycle |
| 4 | KO88 | Order settlement |
| 5 | 1KE5 | Profit center reports |
| 6 | KE30 | CO-PA reports |

## Periodic Reposting (KB61)

Correct wrong assignments:

```
From: Cost Center 1000
To: Cost Center 2000
Amount: $5,000
Reason: Incorrect original posting
```

## Reconciliation

```
FI GL Balance (515000):    $500,000
CO Cost Element (515000):  $500,000
                           --------
Difference:                     $0
```

> **Consistent closing procedures** ensure accurate management reporting!

slides.title: CO Integration Scenarios
slides.content:
# CO Integration with Other Modules

## FI to CO Integration

### Automatic Posting

```
FI Document:
  Dr: 515000 Rent      $10,000
  Cr: 100000 Bank      $10,000
  Cost Center: 1000

Automatic CO Document:
  Cost Center 1000 receives $10,000
  Cost Element 515000
```

## MM to CO Integration

### Goods Receipt

```
PO Receipt:
  Material: RAW001
  Quantity: 100
  Price: $50 each

CO Impact:
  If to Cost Center: Direct posting
  If to Order: Order receives cost
```

## PP to CO Integration

### Production Order

```
Production Order: 60001234
  |
  +-- Material consumption --> Cost Element
  +-- Labor time --> Activity type
  +-- Machine time --> Activity type
  +-- Overhead --> Calculated
```

## SD to CO-PA Integration

### Billing Document

```
Sales Invoice:
  Customer: 100001
  Product: FG001
  Amount: $1,000

CO-PA:
  Revenue: $1,000
  COGS: $650 (from product cost)
  Contribution: $350
  Characteristics: Customer, Product, Region
```

## HR to CO Integration

### Payroll Posting

```
Payroll Results:
  Employee in Cost Center 1000
  Salary: $5,000

CO Posting:
  Cost Center 1000: $5,000
  Cost Element: Personnel Expenses
```

> **CO integrates with all modules** for complete cost visibility!

slides.title: Summary and Key Takeaways
slides.content:
# Congratulations! Summary

You have completed the **SAP Controlling** lesson!

## Key Concepts Mastered

### Cost Elements
- Primary (from GL accounts)
- Secondary (CO only)
- Foundation for cost tracking

### Cost Center Accounting
- Track costs by department
- Planning and budgeting
- Allocations (assessment, distribution)

### Internal Orders
- Temporary cost collectors
- Budgeting and control
- Settlement to receivers

### Profit Center Accounting
- Segment profitability
- Revenue and costs together
- Internal P&L statements

### Product Costing
- Material, labor, overhead
- Standard vs actual costs
- Variance analysis

## Quick Reference

| Function | Key TCode |
|----------|----------|
| Cost Center | KS01 |
| Internal Order | KO01 |
| Profit Center | KE51 |
| Assessment | KSU5 |
| Settlement | KO88 |
| Cost Estimate | CK11N |
| CO-PA Report | KE30 |

## What is Next?

Explore:
- Advanced CO configuration
- SAP integration scenarios
- Material Management interface

> **CO provides the insight** for better business decisions!
